III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was physically abused by staff during an escalated
incident on 11/03/2024.
Investigation The Complainant was contacted on 12/06/2024 and no additional
information was provided.
Youth A was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
11/04/2024. Youth A stated the incident started when he was
trying to fight Youth B, and he also tried to break a window. Youth
A stated he ended up outside and he tried to break a window,
resulting in him being restrained. Youth A described the location
as outside of his cottage by a tree with a large rock. He believed
there were five staff involved and initially did not want to state any
names. During the restraint Youth A was pinned to the ground,
and as this was occurring, he grabbed a female staff member’s
arm. Youth A stated the female staff member then hit him in the
arm. He stated this may have been Staff 5. Youth A also
believed Staff 2 had a hold of his wrist and twisted it during the
restraint. Youth A could not remember exactly what occurred
next. He stated someone put a blanket over him at one point,
causing him to get more upset. Youth A stated that eventually law
enforcement arrived and that was when the restraint ended.
Youth A’s Foster Care Worker provided information on
11/06/2024. She stated she had been in communication with the
facility as well as the school where Youth A had been attending
and was aware of the incident. She stated she had seen Youth A
on 10/28/2024 and he was a part of an incident on 10/29/2024
2

that resulted in a visit to the hospital. She did not express any
other concerns about the facility.
The Chief Administrator and Program Director were
interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 11/07/2024 during an
announced, face-to-face visit. They provided information related
to a separate incident that resulted in Youth A obtaining a
concussion but were not directly apart of this incident pertaining to
the allegations.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 11/07/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit. He recalled the
incident beginning with Youth A and Youth B “horseplaying.” His
definition of that was that the two youth would often play around
with each other, but it would often turn into a verbal or physical
altercation. While they were still inside the cottage, Staff 1 tried to
get both of the youth to stop and had to verbally de-escalate
Youth A from attempting to fight Youth B. Staff 1 was able to then
switch over to be with Youth B and take him outside to remove
him from the situation. As Staff 1 was walking around the cottage
with Youth B he saw Youth A was then outside with Staff 3 and
Staff 4. At that time Youth A was trying to break windows. Staff 4
heard Staff 3 and Staff 4 trying to de-escalate Youth A. Youth A
eventually was on the ground on his back and two staff were
holding his arms. Staff 1 could not describe who was where in
relation to Youth A. Staff 1 recalled Youth A’s head being off of
the ground as he was continually yelling and resisting the
restraint. He also recalled another staff member bringing out a
blanket to put underneath Youth A’s head as a precautionary
measure. He stated that the blanket was never placed over Youth
A. Staff 1 attempted to assist with holding Youth A’s legs but was
unsuccessful in doing so as Youth A kicked back at him. Staff 1
recalled Youth A only calming at the presence of law
enforcement. Staff 1 denied himself or any other staff hitting
Youth A in any way. He also re-iterated that Youth A was never
face down during the restraint.
Youth B was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 11/07/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit. He recalled the
incident starting with he and Youth A fighting. He recalled being
separated from Youth A and going outside with Staff 1. When
Youth B was outside, he saw Youth A push Staff 2. Youth A then
started to throw items at any staff that were near him. Youth B
saw Staff 2 initiate a restraint by attempting to hold Youth A’s
arms from behind him. Youth B did not see any more of the
restraint attempt as he went back inside of the cottage.
3

Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
11/18/2024. He stated that he was not a part of the restraint
outside but interacted with Youth A inside as he escalated. At one
point Youth A had a pot in his hand in the kitchen and attempted
to throw it at Staff 2, and Staff 2 was able to deflect this by
grabbing Youth A’s wrist and Youth A let go of the pot. Staff 2
stated that Youth A then went outside and Staff 2 stayed
inside. He recalled witnessing much of the restraint at that point
from inside. Staff 2 saw Youth A be restrained by other staff and
had no concerns on how this was performed.
Staff 3 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
11/18/2024. Staff 3 recalled interacting with Youth A once he was
outside. Youth A was throwing rocks at windows and escalating
significantly to the point of needing to be restrained. Staff 3 stated
that this quickly turned into a restraint on the ground because
Youth A dropped his weight and fell to the ground. Staff 3 stated
Youth A was on his back the entire time he was on the
ground. He also recalled a blanket being provided to Youth A to
protect his head from the ground, and denied that the blanket was
ever placed over Youth A. Staff 3 denied hitting Youth A in any
way, and denied seeing any other staff do the same.
Staff 4 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
11/18/2024. Staff 4 recalled the day in question, specifically that
Youth A and Youth B had been arguing and needed to be
separated. Staff 4 recalled Staff 2 being with Youth B when Youth
A escalated further and went outside the cottage. Staff 4 recalled
having to initiate a restraint of Youth A with Staff 3 because he
was not able to listen to them and continuing to escalate, including
throwing rocks at the building and at staff. Staff 4 recalled Youth
A slapping her in the face and knocking her glasses off. He also
hit Staff 5 and attempted to bite Staff 3. As Staff 4 and Staff 3
were attempting to restrain Youth A he slid down to the
ground. Youth A then got back up and attempted to fight again,
only for the same attempted restaurant and self-inflicted fall to the
ground to happen again. Staff 4 stated Youth A was restrained on
the ground for a couple more minutes until law enforcement
showed up. She commented that another staff member brought
out a blanket to be used as a pillow while Youth A was on the
ground. Staff 4 recalled Youth A having the recent concussion
and there was concern that he could hit his head on the
ground. Staff 4 denied that the blanket ever choked Youth A or
was above his body in any way. She also stated that she never
hit or pushed Youth A, nor did any other staff involved.
4

Staff 5 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
11/18/2024. Staff 5 recalled attempting to assist in the restraint of
Youth A once they were outside. She confirmed that she was the
staff member who brought out a blanket to use as protection for
Youth A’s head. Staff 5 stated the blanket was never strangling or
covering Youth A in any way. She did this because she was
aware of the recent concussion suffered by Youth A. Staff 5 also
attempted to control Youth A’s legs while he was on his back on
the ground but was unsuccessful in doing so and Staff 1
attempted to take over. Staff 5 recalled Youth A reaching a calm
demeanor when law enforcement arrived. Staff 5 denied seeing
Youth A be hit or pushed by staff in any way.
It was reported during a video conference with DHHS Worker 1
on 12/04/2024 that her investigation had not yet been completed
and no results could yet be shared. It was confirmed on
01/30/2025 that DHHS Worker 1’s investigation did not produce
any findings.
Video footage reviewed:
• Facility security camera footage for the incident that
occurred on 11/03/2024 at approximately 3:00 pm was
provided and reviewed. Youth A was initially seen throwing
rocks at the cottage from the outside and being followed by
staff around the exterior. A clear view of the incident in
question was not able to be viewed as it occurred outside
and a distance away from the exterior camera on the
cottage. At 3:14 pm Youth A could be seen being
restrained on the ground by staff and appeared to be
fighting back. At 3:20 pm Law Enforcement could be seen
arriving at the scene and interacting with Youth A as they
placed him under arrest.
Documentation reviewed:
• Incident report documentation dated 11/03/2024 was
provided and reviewed. Separate incident reports authored
by Staff 1, Staff 4, and Staff 5 all provided similar
descriptions of the incident and had no inconsistencies
from the interviews provided.
• Training documentation for Staff 2 was provided and
reviewed, showing he was current on his restraint model
training as of 07/09/2024.
• Facility policy titled “Physical Intervention” and last dated
09/01/2024 was provided and reviewed. This policy stated
5

that staff were never to intervene with the use of physical
restraint in order “to inflict pain or harm.”
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, video footage and other documentation
reviewed. There was no evidence found to show that Youth A’s
head was pushed to the ground or that he was choked or hit by
staff while being restrained.
Technical Assistance provided:
• The facility is advised to consider its health services policy
to ensure that necessary medical information for youth is
shared with all staff that would need it. Multiple staff
members involved in the incident that occurred on
11/03/2024 were aware that Youth A had recently suffered
a concussion, but multiple others were not aware. Had this
information been shared more widely it could have had a
positive effect on the situation.
Consultation provided:
• The facility is advised to edit policy and procedures
regarding behavior management and physical management
of youth to ensure that the prohibited acts within rule
400.4158 (1) (a) (ii) are clearly outlined within the policy.
• The facility is advised to review policy and procedures
specific to the use of physical managements to align with
rule 400.4160. The use of emergency restraint no longer
includes the sole reason being the destruction of property.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
